intro: Guneria veratrifolia, commonly known as the white-flowered guneria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers with five petals. It produces a milky sap that is typically toxic, a common trait among members of its family. Guneria veratrifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils in woodland and shrubland habitats.
